intro: Geocarpon groenlandicum, commonly known as the Greenland earthstar, is a unique fungal plant that belongs to the family Geogophyllaceae. It is a subterranean plant that produces a distinctive star-shaped fruiting body called an earthstar, which emerges from the soil. The plant is characterized by its fleshy, spore-bearing structures that are often covered in a sticky, gelatinous coating. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is typically found in temperate regions. Due to its specialized growth habits, it plays a role in soil aeration and nutrient cycling in its ecosystem.
